abstract: Like students who choose to go to college in a small town to avoid the distractions of big-city life, the venture capitalists at Foundry Group have shunned Silicon Valley or New York for Boulder, where they practice back-to-the-basics venture capital.
snippet: Like students who choose to go to college in a small town to avoid the distractions of big-city life, the venture capitalists at Foundry Group have shunned Silicon Valley or New York for Boulder, where they practice back-to-the-basics venture capi...
lead_paragraph: Like students who choose to go to college in a small town to avoid the distractions of big-city life, the venture capitalists at Foundry Group have shunned Silicon Valley or New York for Boulder, Colo., The New York Times’s Claire Cain Miller writes.

headline.main: For Foundry, V.C. the Old-Fashioned Way

abstract: The company will now focus on marketing the phone through existing retail channels — and will soon stop selling the handsets online altogether.
snippet: The company will now focus on marketing the phone through existing retail channels — and will soon stop selling the handsets online altogether.
lead_paragraph: Google’s flagship Nexus One phone debuted earlier this year to much fanfare. The phone was not only flashy — evocative of Apple’s iPhone in many respects — but Google was also using it to try to change the dynamics of the wireless industry by selling it directly from its Web store and bypassing the powerful wireless carriers.

headline.main: Google Admits Defeat in Selling Nexus One Direct

byline.original: By Brad Stone and Miguel Helft

abstract: The admission, involving the scanning of Wi-Fi networks to improve its mapping products, contradicts the company’s previous claims.
snippet: The admission, involving the scanning of Wi-Fi networks to improve its mapping products, contradicts the company’s previous claims.
lead_paragraph: On Friday, Google made a stunning admission: for over three years, it has inadvertently collected snippets of private information that people send over unencrypted wireless networks.

headline.main: Google Says It Inadvertently Collected Personal Data
